postsData.name:
Garett Moreau ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸
Garett Moreau ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸
postsData.content:
FACE IT: Computers were a mistake.
UnitedHealth has confirmed the ransomware attack on its Change Healthcare unit last February affected around 190 million people in America â€” nearly *double* previous estimates.

That's... Rather a lot.

In addition to the usual laundry list of stolen data like addresses, ph numbers, DOB, SSN, etc, it also includes diagnoses, medications, test results, imaging, and care and treatment plans, as well as health insurance information.

â€œChange said the data also includes financial and banking information found in patient claims.â€

So, basically, everything.

UnitedHealth's spokesperson said the company was "not aware of any misuse of individuals' information as a result of this incident and has not seen electronic medical record databases appear in the data during the analysis."
But did you actually look?
postsData.commentAdded: This is a wake-up call for the healthcare sector. Cybersecurity must be a top priority to protect sensitive patient data. #DataSecurity

postsData.name:
Eric Giguere
Eric Giguere
postsData.content:
"It was like running a train station where every train was labeled 'urgent.'" â€“ Benjamin

As a tech leader, Benjaminâ€™s team was drowning in constant firefighting.

Everything was labeled â€œtop priority.â€

The result? Burnout. Chaos. Sluggish progress.

Inspired by actual train stations, Benjamin made a bold move:
 Created dedicated tracks for different initiatives
â±ï¸ Set clear â€œarrival and departureâ€ times for key deliverables
ï¸ Built in â€œmaintenance windowsâ€ for team development and process improvements

The results were transformative:
 Dramatically reduced the # of emergencies \(Less than Half\)
 Teams flowing like a well-run station
 Record-high satisfaction scores and gained Velocity

"We still have urgent matters," Benjamin says, "but now we can handle them without derailing everything else."

What would happen if you created â€œtracksâ€ to organize your priorities?

Letâ€™s hear your thoughts in the comments!

comments.commentText: A great concept. If everything is a fire drill and urgent - nothing is urgent. It creates stress and confusing priorities.

postsData.commentAdded: Love this approach, Benjamin! Organizing priorities like train tracks can truly transform efficiency and team morale. ğŸš‚ğŸ’¡ Whatâ€™s the next step?

postsData.name:
Fabio Ciucci
Fabio Ciucci
postsData.content:
Replaced ChatGPT $200/month with free DeepSeek yet? Go to chat . deepseek . com , click "DeepThink" for R1 mode.
API calls cost $0.14 per million input token vs OpenAI's $7.5/m; or you can host it in your Nvidia pc for free local use.

DeepSeek is open source, so others will "copy" and improve it under many names and branches (expect a META LlamaSeek?), increasing price pressure on ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, etc.

Nature (and every other reliable publication): "Tests of DeepSeek R1 show that its performance on certain tasks in chemistry, mathematics, and coding is on par with that of ChatGPT o1". No need for marketing, really.

DeepSeek causes big tech bros to panic. How will they keep their AI's inflated valuations and build more mega data centers if a free app requires a smaller server?
ChatGPT loses money at $200/month, they revealed, so can't just cut prices: they have to change system.

Two notes:

- If using it online on deepseek com, is hosted in China, and its privacy policy includes: "collecting keystroke patterns or rythms". But anyone can host it in US or EU.

- Will answer aligned with the Chinese Communist Party on some topics (Taiwan, Xi Jinping, etc.). It would require retraining if you wish it Western way.

Chinese open source that can run on a (Nvidia powered) notebook won a match against US closed source that needs mega data centers.

DeepSeek is not exactly the TikTok of AI because everyone can copy and edit it: a contribution to humanity more than domination. Still, it reminds us that earth shattering stuff comes from China by surprise at times.

ï¸Repost and followfor more.

comments.commentText: Running now, I'm amazed!

postsData.commentAdded: Exciting to see DeepSeek shaking up the AI landscape! Innovation often comes from unexpected places. Looking forward to its potential impact!

postsData.name:
Apoorva Choudhary
Apoorva Choudhary
postsData.content:
Why Great Managers Are the Secret to Keeping Employees Happy

Imagine this: Youâ€™ve got a dream job, but your managerâ€™s behavior makes every day feel like a chore.

Sound familiar? Studies show 57% of employees leave jobs because of their manager, and 14% have done it multiple times.

Even worse, 32% have thought seriously about quitting for the same reason.
Itâ€™s not just about paychecks anymore.

People want respect, balance, and opportunities to grow. When managers fail to provide that, it sparks a chain reaction.

According to a 2022 report, 4.2 million workers quit, and the ripple effect of one person leaving can cause others to follow.

A study of 1,600 teams found that when a manager lacks agility or key skills, their team struggles too.

Micromanaging? Poor leadership? These push great employees out the door.
The fix? Managers who are empathetic, transparent, and supportive.

Skills like trust-building, clear communication, and vision can transform a team.

Good managers donâ€™t just manage they inspire. And when they do, businesses thrive.

comments.commentText: Well said Apoorva Choudhary Managers who prioritize trust, respect, and growth opportunities not only retain talent but also build high-performing teams. A win-win for everyone.

postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely! Great managers are essential for employee satisfaction and retention. Leadership truly can make or break a teams success. ğŸŒŸ

Inga Stirbyte
Inga Stirbyte
postsData.content:
A strong CISO strategy isnâ€™t optional!
Itâ€™s essential. 

In todayâ€™s digital age, CISOs arenâ€™t just protecting data

Theyâ€™re driving business resilience and competitive advantage.

Are you prioritizing cybersecurity at the executive level?

PS: Whatâ€™s your biggest challenge in aligning security with business goals?

comments.commentText:
Inga Stirbyte thanks for sharing. 

To truly empower CISOs and enable them to effectively mitigate the ever-growing cyber risks facing organizations, a board seat is essential. This elevated position provides the authority necessary to implement comprehensive security strategies and influence critical business decisions. However, with this increased responsibility comes increased liability.

Therefore, it's imperative that CISOs' roles are explicitly included under Directors and Officers (D&O) insurance policies. This proactive measure protects both the individual and the organization, ensuring CISOs can effectively champion cybersecurity without undue personal risk.

The time for reactive responses is over; proactive inclusion of CISOs in board-level decision-making and D&O coverage is a strategic necessity for every modern organization.

postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely agree! A strong CISO strategy is crucial for both protection and business growth. Curious to hear what challenges others are facing!

postsData.name:
Austin Nasso
Austin Nasso
postsData.content:
I make $340,000 per year in San Francisco as a software engineer and it's utterly unlivable. 

Let's break it down.

After taxes, my take home is approximately $220,000 or $18,400/mo

Rent for 2 bd/2ba apartment in Pacific Heights: $9,500

Cybertruck lease: $1368

Pack and fold laundry service: $200.

Doordash salads: $1680

Dinner and Drinks for Hinge Dates: $2380 (excluding 2-michelin star+)

Skiing: $2650 (average per mo)

New shirt: $20.

Entertainment/Fun Budget: $1802

total: $19,400

Despite working my butt off for 30 hours per week remotely and making $340,000 per year, I am somehow in the position where I'm losing $1,000 per month.

What is wrong with this city?

comments.commentText: Seriously? OK, Iâ€™ll comment. Yeah, San Francisco has its problems. YOUR problem is you donâ€™t know how to manage your money. if you can work remote, why are you spending $10,000 a month to rent in San Francisco? Thatâ€™s just for starters. Youâ€™re wasting money all over the place. Quit blaming San Francisco. Youâ€™re making stupid decisions. I realize this may be satire, but seriously I do not understand why people live in San Francisco. Itâ€™s turned into a dump.
Frederick Bryant Right over your head Fred. Stop being dopey.

My suggestions.

Cyber Truck lease: $1368. Solution, Lease a 2025 Mercedes-Benz C 300 Sedan in the San Francisco area from approximately $491 to $579

Pack and fold laundry service: $200. Solution, Do your own laundry

Door Dash salads: $1680. Solution, If you make salads daily and buy ingredients in bulk, expect to spend around $200â€“$300 per month on groceries for salads, depending on the variety and quality of ingredients. Shopping at local farmers' markets or discount stores can help reduce costs.

Dinner and Drinks for Hinge Dates: $2380 (excluding 2-michelin star+)
Solution, Buffalo Wild Wings Dinner for two, 20 Traditional Wings: Approximately $19.99. Drinks: Assuming two beverages at around $3 each, totaling $6. Taxes and Tips: Estimating an additional 20% brings the total to approximately $31.19. Therefore, a single dinner for two at Buffalo Wild Wings in San Francisco would cost around $31.19. If you plan to dine there once a week, the monthly expense would be approximately $124.76.

Skiing: $2650 (average per mo) Solution, Golden Gate Park Skate Rentals:
Cost: $20 for the first hour and $5 for each additional hour

New shirt: $20. Solution

Entertainment/Fun Budget: $1802 Solution, Play pool

postsData.commentAdded: Its astounding how quickly costs can outpace income, even at high salaries. How can we rethink living expenses in San Francisco?

postsData.name:
Priyank Ahuja
Priyank Ahuja

comments.commentText:
I respectfully disagree. In many cases, a well-paying job can provide peace of mind by ensuring financial security and stability. While itâ€™s important not to sacrifice health, relationships, or values for money, earning a sufficient salary acts as a safeguard against unexpected challenges, such as job loss. For example, even if a low-paying job feels peaceful, sudden layoffs could leave you financially vulnerable, no matter how supportive your manager may be.
On the other hand, individuals with financial stabilityâ€”such as those from well-off backgrounds or with ancestral propertyâ€”might prioritize peace of mind over a high salary. However, for those without a safety net, earning a higher salary is often not just a desire but a necessity.
In my opinion, striking the right balance between financial security and personal well-being is essential for long-term stability and peace of mind.
It's important to prioritize our mental and emotional well-being over a higher salary.

postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely agree! Job satisfaction and peace of mind are priceless. Prioritizing values over salary leads to a fulfilling career.

postsData.name:
Mark Tanchoco Reid
Mark Tanchoco Reid
postsData.content:
Today, I'm reflecting on what truly matters: the heartbeat of our lives - family (if we are lucky enough to have one).

As an entrepreneur and coach for professionals, I've learned that success isn't just measured in business metrics, but in the strength of our relationships and the values we cherish. 

Every strategy session, every breakthrough with my clients, is ultimately about empowering individuals to create meaningful lives - not just profitable ones.

My journey has taught me that our most significant investments aren't in stocks or startups, but in the people we love. ï¸

The resilience we build at home becomes the foundation of our professional courage.

The empathy we cultivate with our loved ones transforms how we lead and connect with others.

To my fellow entrepreneurs: remember that your greatest legacy isn't your business portfolio, but the lives you touch and the values you instill in those closest to you. 

Stay purposeful. Stay connected.   

What's the one relationship or value that has been your greatest source of strength in your entrepreneurial journey?

comments.commentText: Powerful message, Mark! Totally resonate with balancing professional success and personal values.

postsData.commentAdded: Such a powerful message! Family truly empowers us in both life and business. The connections we nurture are our greatest assets. Thank you for sharing!

When I pitched my first book, Confidence Creator, the rejections rolled in.

Over and over, I heard the same thing: â€œYouâ€™re not a writer.â€ 

For a moment, I let those words sink in.

I thought, Maybe theyâ€™re right. Maybe Iâ€™m not cut out for this.

But then, I snapped out of it.

I thought, Why am I letting someone else define me?

Who says I canâ€™t write a book?

So, I stopped waiting for someone elseâ€™s approval.

I self-published Confidence Creator, and guess what?

It became an Amazon #1 bestsellerâ€”in multiple categories! 

That moment taught me a powerful lesson:

You donâ€™t need anyoneâ€™s permission to chase your dreams.

Your worth isnâ€™t determined by other peopleâ€™s opinions.

Itâ€™s determined by you. 

The world responds to the energy you bring to it.

Start believing youâ€™re worthy of successâ€”and watch everything change.

postsData.name:
Mahan Tavakoli
Mahan Tavakoli
postsData.content:
When did we start letting opinions decide the facts?


Take nutrition, for example.

I studied human nutrition, pursued graduate research in it, and still find the field fascinating.

Science in the field has evolvedâ€”some findings have changed, but much of it remains the same.


Thatâ€™s how science works: it grows, refines, and builds on itself over time, grounded in evidence.


But today, facts are often decided by the communityâ€”by what feels popular rather than whatâ€™s backed by evidence.

Influencers with little understanding of biology, let alone nutrition science, share all kinds of â€œfacts,â€ and their opinions, as well as anecdotal examples, often carry more weight than years of research.

And because science sometimes changes, people use that as an excuse to reject it altogether.


Expertise isnâ€™t perfect, but itâ€™s built on evidence and years of learningâ€”giving us the confidence to make better decisions.

When we let loud voices or popularity decide whatâ€™s true, we lose the foundation that real progress depends on.


This isnâ€™t just about nutrition.

The same trend shows up in leadership, health, and other areas of our lives, where anecdotes and opinions drown out expertise.


Facts, expertise, and understanding arenâ€™t just the foundation of strong decisionsâ€”theyâ€™re pillars of progress and the bedrock of a thriving society.

And yet, more and more, weâ€™re outsourcing truth to popularity contests.

What could go wrong?


P.S. Speaking of truth, does the sun revolve around the Earthâ€”or is it the other way around?

Cast your votes belowâ€”because clearly, the community gets to decide whatâ€™s true.

comments.commentText: Mahan - I sense that thereâ€™s a specific example about nutrition thatâ€™s fueling this post? Can you share?
Wow! Well said Mahan Tavakoli...
comments.userName: Ambassador Terry Earthwind Nichols International Speaker Strategist

postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely agree! Letting popularity dictate facts undermines progress. We must prioritize evidence and expertise for informed decision-making.

postsData.content:
I'm currently deep diving into the topic of 
#COACHING with Stanford University Graduate School of Business / Stanford LEAD 

I foundpage super helpful during my studies and coaching practices. The "Self-Coaching" concept is something definitely worth sharing!



Ed Batista is an executive coach with over 8,000 sessions of experience, working with senior leaders across industries like technology, investing, and healthcare.

"The Art of Self-Coaching is a course that I designed and launched at the Stanford Graduate School of Business (GSB) in Spring 2015 and have taught 13 times in the intervening years. In Spring 2020, the GSB moved all courses online in response to COVID-19, and in an effort to make a small contribution to help people cope with the pandemic, I offered a freely available online version of the course to the public. I recorded the live webinar sessions, and those videos, my slides, and all course readings have been posted below, so you can now take the course at the time of your choosing and at your own pace."

LINK in the 1st comment. Enjoy

comments.commentText: I'm so glad to hear you're finding The Art of Self-Coaching useful, Tomasz!

postsData.commentAdded: Fantastic initiative, Ed! Self-coaching can transform personal and professional development. Excited to explore your course materials!
